idAbs.para: Iterates over workspaces in a folder.

summary.para: Iterates over workspaces in a folder.

pythonReference.para: Folder which stores the workspace to iterate.

dialogReference.para: Folder which stores the workspace to iterate.

pythonReference.para: Combination of * and characters that help to limit the results. The asterisk is the same as saying ALL. If no wildcard is specified, all inputs will be returned. For example, it can be used to restrict Iteration over input names starting with a certain character or word (e.g., A* or Ari* or Land*,and so on).

dialogReference.para: Combination of * and characters that help to limit the results. The asterisk is the same as saying ALL. If no wildcard is specified, all inputs will be returned. For example, it can be used to restrict Iteration over input names starting with a certain character or word (e.g., A* or Ari* or Land*,and so on).

pythonReference.para: Choose the Workspace Type, such as Access, Coverage, FileGDB, Folder, or SDE.

bulletList.bullet_item: ACCESS—Only Access database will be the output.
COVERAGE—Only Coverage will be the output.
FILEGDB—Only File Geodatabase will be the output.
FOLDER—Only Folder will be the output.
SDE—Only SDE database will be the output.

dialogReference.para: Choose the Workspace Type, such as Access, Coverage, FileGDB, Folder, or SDE.

bulletList.bullet_item: ACCESS—Only Access database will be the output.
COVERAGE—Only Coverage will be the output.
FILEGDB—Only File Geodatabase will be the output.
FOLDER—Only Folder will be the output.
SDE—Only SDE database will be the output.

pythonReference.para: Determines if subfolders in the main folder will be iterated through recursively.

bulletList.bullet_item: Unchecked—Set as Default. Will not iterate through all subfolders.

dialogReference.para: Determines if subfolders in the main folder will be iterated through recursively.

bulletList.bullet_item: Unchecked—Set as Default. Will not iterate through all subfolders.

bullet_item.para: This tool is intended for use in ModelBuilder and not in Python scripting.
Iterate workspace can be limited to iterate over workspace types such as Access, Coverage, FileGDB, Folder, or SDE.
The tool has two outputs: Output Workspace and Name which could be used as %Name% in other tools.

If an Iterator is added to a model, all tools in the model iterate for each value in the iterator. If you do not want to run each tool in the model for each iterated value, create a that contains only the iterator and add it as a model tool into the main model.
